main_definition: The appropriate or opportune moment to do something; the right or suitable timing.

meanings_and_examples.example: His promotion and her resignation were perfect timing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The moment at which an event occurs or a decision is made
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to propose to him when she saw how well he had recovered from his injury, believing it was the right timing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Appropriateness of timing for actions in relation to goals
meanings_and_examples.example: To succeed in this business venture, perfect timing is essential. The market needs have just shifted and are now favorable.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The skill or ability to judge when to act or react appropriately
meanings_and_examples.example: He has great timing with jokes; he always knows the right moment to make people laugh.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The degree of synchronization between different elements, actions, or events
meanings_and_examples.example: Good timing in a dance routine ensures all partners move together smoothly and in harmony.
